individual_guitar.significance_notes: Slash's main guitar 'Jessica' - used on tour with Guns N' Roses, Velvet Revolver, and current GNR reunions. Features cigarette burn from road wear. Originally brighter cherry sunburst, refinished to duller finish.
individual_guitar.modifications: Refinished from brighter cherry sunburst to duller finish. Has medium neck and three-piece top. Cigarette burn mark from dropping cigarette.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Acquired by Slash in 1988 during Guns N' Roses tour. Called 'Jessica' by Slash.
individual_guitar.description: Faded cherry sunburst Les Paul Standard with medium neck and three-piece top
Black Les Paul Custom with rosewood neck, custom order
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Custom order placed by Slash with Gibson Custom Shop, built with rosewood neck because Slash finds ebony necks 'too bright for everyday use'. Toured with both Guns N' Roses and Slash featuring Myles Kennedy and The Conspirators.
individual_guitar.modifications: Rosewood neck (custom specification instead of standard ebony)

individual_guitar.description: Off-white Firebird prototype developed with Gibson Custom Shop
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Prototype Firebird model developed by Slash with Gibson Custom Shop for his signature line. Modified to address issues with mini humbuckers on stage.
individual_guitar.modifications: Seymour Duncan pickups replacing mini humbuckers, modified neck profile

individual_guitar.description: Flame top Les Paul without pickguard, early signature model
individual_guitar.significance_notes: One of Slash's first signature models made with Gibson, based on guitar from Chicago NAMM show. Gibson made a few with Slash's name on truss rod cover.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Based on guitar seen at Chicago NAMM show that looked like Slash's guitars. Slash no longer owns one.

individual_guitar.description: Black Les Paul with snake inlays on neck and hand-carved painted details
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Custom guitar made by Gibson for Slash's Snakepit band with snake inlay on neck and hand-carved details. Used on road with Snakepit. Part of limited run of maybe 20 or fewer guitars.
individual_guitar.modifications: Snake inlay on neck, hand-carved and painted details
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Custom made for Snakepit, limited run production. Slash wishes he had more.

individual_guitar.significance_notes: Used to record 'Knocking on Heaven's Door' for Use Your Illusion album. Featured in 'The Beauty of the Burst' book. Purchased for $250,000.
individual_guitar.modifications: Pickup covers were already removed when Slash acquired the guitar
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Purchased from Albert Molinaro before Use Your Illusion recording for $250,000

individual_guitar.significance_notes: One of two 1958 Gibson Korina Explorers purchased along with the 1958 Flying V. Extremely rare vintage instrument.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Purchased along with 1958 Korina Flying V

individual_guitar.description: Murphy Lab 1958 Korina Flying V reissue
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Modern reissue of the famous 1958 Korina Flying V, part of Gibson's Murphy Lab aged series.

individual_guitar.description: Murphy Lab 1958 Korina Explorer reissue
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Modern reissue of the famous 1958 Korina Explorer, part of Gibson's Murphy Lab aged series.
Christmas gift from Slash's significant other Megan in 2021. Used on Slash's most recent album released in 2022.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Christmas gift from Megan in 2021

individual_guitar.description: Dark burst 1959 Les Paul featured in 'The Beauty of the Burst'
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Featured in 'The Beauty of the Burst' book. Acquired from someone reluctant to sell but was persuaded when they realized Slash would use it to fill void left by returning Joe Perry Les Paul.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Acquired to replace returned Joe Perry Les Paul

individual_guitar.description: Black Mockingbird with Floyd Rose tremolo system
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Used to record 'You Could Be Mine' and toured during Use Your Illusion tour. Currently being used again with Guns N' Roses reunion.
individual_guitar.modifications: Floyd Rose tremolo system, active electronics bypassed for passive use
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Purchased from acquaintance on the street in 1989 or 1990

individual_guitar.description: Green 10-string Mockingbird custom made by BC Rich
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Custom 10-string Mockingbird made by BC Rich for Slash. Used on stage with Guns N' Roses.

individual_guitar.description: Red Mockingbird
individual_guitar.significance_notes: One of Slash's collection of BC Rich Mockingbirds from the late 1980s.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Purchased from friend in 1989 or 1990 on Highland Boulevard

individual_guitar.description: First 'good' electric guitar owned by Slash
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Slash's first 'good' electric guitar, a short-horn Mockingbird model from 1977 or 1978. Significant as his introduction to quality electric guitars.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Slash's first quality electric guitar

individual_guitar.description: Natural finish archtop model, heaviest of three Travis Bean guitars
individual_guitar.significance_notes: One of Slash's oldest electric guitars, owned since before Guns N' Roses formation. Used primarily for slide playing. Heaviest of his three Travis Bean guitars because it's an archtop.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Owned since before Guns N' Roses, one of three Travis Bean guitars

individual_guitar.description: Three-tone sunburst Bass VI
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Used to beef up parts in recordings and specifically featured on 'Welcome to the Jungle'.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Purchased from Norm's Rare Guitars

individual_guitar.description: Black Les Paul Standard, same year as 'Jessica'
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Recently acquired Les Paul from same year as his famous 'Jessica' guitar, with serial number almost identical.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Recently acquired, same year and similar serial number to 'Jessica'

individual_guitar.description: Natural finish with 6-string acoustic neck on top, 6-string electric neck on bottom
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Custom design developed by Slash with Guild. One of two guitars (natural and black) for touring rigs. Primarily used for 'Civil War'.
individual_guitar.modifications: Custom Slash design: 6-string acoustic top, 6-string electric bottom

individual_guitar.description: Black finish with 6-string acoustic neck on top, 6-string electric neck on bottom
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Custom design developed by Slash with Guild. One of two guitars (natural and black) for touring rigs. Primarily used for 'Civil War'.
individual_guitar.modifications: Custom Slash design: 6-string acoustic top, 6-string electric bottom

individual_guitar.description: Green finish with 12-string acoustic neck on top, 6-string electric neck on bottom
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Another variation of Slash's custom Guild Crossroads design, featuring 12-string acoustic on top and 6-string electric on bottom.
individual_guitar.modifications: Custom Slash design: 12-string acoustic top, 6-string electric bottom

individual_guitar.description: Tobacco sunburst Les Paul replica built by luthier Kris Derrig
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Called 'The Derrig' by Slash, used on almost every record he's made. Main guitar during Guns N' Roses first US tour. Acquired through manager Alan Niven.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Acquired through manager Alan Niven. Slash never met luthier Kris Derrig who made it.

individual_guitar.description: Tobacco sunburst Slash signature model
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Slash's first full production line of guitars with Gibson. Originally had piezo pickup system removed by Slash. Main guitar for Velvet Revolver period.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: First full production Slash signature line with Gibson

individual_guitar.description: Trans green prototype with Brazilian rosewood neck
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Prototype for Slash's Brazilian Dream Les Paul signature model. Used for Living the Dream tour and in B rig for Guns N' Roses.

individual_guitar.description: Dark burst 1958 Les Paul, two-piece top
individual_guitar.significance_notes: First sunburst Les Paul with two-piece top. Gibson did a replica of it. Slash says it sounds 'fucking great'.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Gibson made replicas of this guitar

individual_guitar.description: 1959 Les Paul purchased from Albert Molinaro
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Another 1959 Les Paul from Slash's collection, purchased from Albert Molinaro.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Purchased from Albert Molinaro

individual_guitar.significance_notes: Used on the album 'Living the Dream'. Vintage Goldtop from the mid-1950s.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Used for Living the Dream album recording

individual_guitar.significance_notes: Purchased from Norm's Rare Guitars after seeing it on 'Guitar of the Day'. Another vintage Goldtop in Slash's collection.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Purchased from Norm's Rare Guitars, seen on 'Guitar of the Day'

individual_guitar.description: Go-to 1959 Les Paul for studio recording
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Slash's go-to 1959 Les Paul for studio recording. Used on Living the Dream album and recording of 'Rocket Man'.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Primary studio recording guitar

individual_guitar.description: Black double neck guitar with 12-string and 6-string necks
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Used to play 'Heaven's Door'. Classic Gibson double neck model purchased used.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Purchased used

individual_guitar.description: Goldtop inspired by stolen 1957 darkback Les Paul Goldtop
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Named 'Victoria' after the person who stole the original 1957 darkback Les Paul Goldtop that inspired this guitar.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Inspired by stolen 1957 Les Paul, named after the thief

individual_guitar.description: Uncle's guitar found in closet with one string
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Slash's uncle's guitar that he found in a closet with only one string. Guitar where Slash learned his first riffs.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Found in uncle's closet, Slash's first guitar experience

individual_guitar.description: Sunburst Les Paul copy, eventually destroyed
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Traded from Memphis Explorer copy. Slash said it was unplayable and eventually put it through a wall. Part of his early guitar journey.
individual_guitar.modifications: Eventually destroyed by putting through wall
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Traded from Memphis Explorer copy, destroyed due to being unplayable

individual_guitar.description: First electric guitar, traded for Les Paul copy
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Slash's first electric guitar. He was uncomfortable with the Explorer shape and traded it for a Memphis Les Paul copy.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Slash's first electric guitar, traded away due to uncomfortable shape

individual_guitar.description: Natural finish acoustic guitar with bolted tailpiece
individual_guitar.significance_notes: Acquired from people Slash babysat for as a teenager. Notable for its unusual bolted tailpiece construction.
individual_guitar.provenance_notes: Acquired from babysitting clients during teenage years
